Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

As the new campaigns director here at ACLU of Pennsylvania, I wanted to take a moment to introduce myself and to ask you to join me in the fight to end mass incarceration in Pennsylvania.

Pennsylvania has a mass incarceration crisis, with the highest incarceration rate in the Northeast. Probation and parole violations are major drivers of this epidemic, accounting for over half of the new admissions to the state system.

But the good news is that we are in a rare political moment where people across the political spectrum recognize the urgent need to reform our criminal legal system. There is bipartisan support from advocates and lawmakers for Senate Bill 14, a bill that would dramatically improve our probation system and prevent thousands of people from cycling back through the system for years for minor violations.

Rallies for criminal law reform

Join our criminal law reform allies for two Harrisburg rallies this month to demand an end to mass incarceration and to challenge racism in the commonwealth.

Wednesday, October 23, 12 – 3 p.m.
Wednesday, October 30, 11 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.
Pennsylvania State Capitol Complex
Main Rotunda
501 N 3rd St.
Harrisburg, PA 17120


Legislators from both sides of the aisle need to hear that their constituents reject the old-tough-on-crime approach and instead want real criminal law reform. Join us and our coalition partners for two upcoming rallies in support of probation reform in Harrisburg on October 23 and October 30.

If you're interested in learning more about the campaign and getting involved but can't make it to Harrisburg this month, please contact me at smartjustice@aclupa.org to find out what you can do locally to support probation reform.

I look forward to working with you towards dignity and justice for all.

In solidarity,

Danitra Sherman
Campaigns Director, ACLU of Pennsylvania
